overview:
Interactive markets executive with extensive experience both in emerging and established technology companies.

Currently, Jason is VP of Sales and Business Development for LeadQual based in Emeryville.

LeadQual increases Internet Marketing ROI by generating, qualifying and converting Internet leads. We manage pay-per-click internet advertising programs and provide search engine optimization services.

Through its lead qualification system, LeadQual improves conversion of internet leads by calling prospective buyers within minutes of the prospect completing a lead form, qualifying based on client’s screening criteria, and then live transferring qualified buyers to the clientâ€™s sales force.

LeadQual was ranked #1 fastest growing Internet Marketing company in the nation, according to 2010 Deloitte Technology Fast 500.

Before LeadQual, Jason was at TARGUSinfo as a Director of Strategic Accounts having opened their San Francisco regional sales office while responsible for maintaining and growing much of their West Coast sales footprint. TARGUSinfo is the leading provider of On-Demand Information services. Its unique identification, verification, and qualification services enable advertisers, agencies, publishers, lead generators, communication service providers and others to dramatically increase the quality of their services and the effectiveness of their marketing.TARGUSinfo was acquired by Neustar in October of 2011.

Jason also served as part of the launch team at Matchpoint.com, eventually being acquired by Company.com who acquired the technology platform to kick start their growth. During his time at Matchpoint.com Jason was responsible for revenue strategy and execution. Prior to Matchpoint.com Jason worked at Homegain.com (Classified Ventures) in strategic sales working to build out new revenue channels focusing on untapped growing markets. Jason also has worked for Arnold Advertising and Alloy Media Group in Boston.

Jason attended Gettysburg College from 1994-1998 studying Business Management.
